definitions.definition: The study of the way sounds function in languages , including accent , intonation , phonemes , stress , and syllable structure , and which sounds are distinctive units within a language; ( countable ) the way sounds function within a given language; a phonological system .

The study of the way components of signs function in a sign language , and which components are distinctive units within the language; ( countable ) the way components of signs function within a given sign language.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The study of the way sounds function in languages , including accent , intonation , phonemes , stress , and syllable structure , and which sounds are distinctive units within a language; ( countable ) the way sounds function within a given language; a phonological system . [from late 18th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( by extension , uncountable ) The study of the way components of signs function in a sign language , and which components are distinctive units within the language; ( countable ) the way components of signs function within a given sign language.
